Description: Rim sherd of East Greek pottery plate; pale slip; on top of flat rim frieze of rays between narrow bands; single dot between rays; at junction of floor and rim, wide black band with bands in added red and white; to centre, part of maeander frieze preserved; on edge of rim short vertical bars; exterior: below rim and on body, bands.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Ure Museum of Greek Archaeology, Reading. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

For parallels, see Walter-Karydi, ‘Samos - VI/1 Samische Gefässe des 6. Jahrhunderts v. Chr.’, Bonn (1973), pl. 123, fig. 1001 (British Museum 1888,0601.544a). The sherd probably belongs to the same vase as Alexandria 17265.
Bibliographic references: CVA Reading I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain, Fasc. 12, University of Reading (p. 35, pl. 22, no. 2a-b)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.711)
